# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objs as go

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.e69fa664:
#Code by Siti K https://www.kaggle.com/khotijahs1/2020-indonesia-university-rank/comments

#10 Sports by Skill Flexibility
top_flex = df.sort_values(by='Flexibility', ascending=False)[:10]
figure = plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sns.barplot(y=top_flex.Sport, x=top_flex.Flexibility)
plt.xticks()
plt.xlabel('Flexibility')
plt.ylabel('Sport')
plt.title('10 Sports by Skill Flexibility')
plt.show()
source.c273ed4c:
#Amount of Confidence/ Nerve feature
df_confidence = df.Nerve.value_counts().sort_index().reset_index()

# Bar plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8,5))
sns.barplot(x=df_confidence['index'], y=df_confidence.Nerve, color='red', alpha=0.7)
sns.despine(bottom=True, left=True)
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.xlabel('Self-confidence', fontsize=13)
plt.ylabel('Count', fontsize=13)
plt.title('Sports Skill: Self-confidence ', fontsize=15)
plt.show()
source.ba9895ee:
# Amount of Longevity/ Durability feature
df_long = df.Durability.value_counts().sort_index().reset_index()

# Bar plot
plt.figure(figsize=(8,5))
sns.barplot(x=df_long['index'], y=df_long.Durability, color='green', alpha=0.7)
sns.despine(bottom=True, left=True)
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.xlabel('Longevity', fontsize=13)
plt.ylabel('Count', fontsize=13)
plt.title('Sports Skill: Longevity', fontsize=15)
plt.show()

#10 Sports by Skill Durability
top_long = df.sort_values(by='Durability', ascending=True)[:10]
figure = plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
sns.barplot(y=top_long.Sport, x=top_long.Durability)
plt.xticks()
plt.xlabel('Durability')
plt.ylabel('Sport')
plt.title('10 Sports by Skill Longevity')
plt.show()
source.d37d886c:
"When asked what it's like to experience the "twisties," which is the term for when a gymnast's air awareness is off."

"Literally can not tell up from down. It's the craziest feeling ever. Not having an inch of control over your body. What's even scarier is since I have no idea where I am in the air, I also have NO idea how I am going to land. Or what I am going to land on. Head/hands/feet back…," Biles wrote. "I didn't have a bad performance and quit. I've had plenty of bad performances throughout my career and finished competition. I simply got so lost my safety was at risk as well as a team medal."

https://abcnews.go.com/Sports/simone-biles-explains-withdrawal-olympics-mind-body-simply/story?id=79157744

source.d2b077c7:
#Oldest Olympians

"The oldest Olympian to compete in the Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games (2016) was 62-year old Julie Brougham from New Zealand, aiming for her first-ever Olympic medal in equestrian dressage"

"The oldest gold medalist in Olympic history was Oscar Swahn from Sweden,at 64 years old  he participated in 1912 as a shooter in the single-shot running deer team. He returned to the Games in 1920 as a 72-year-old, taking a silver medal in another team shooting event."

https://www.verywellfit.com/olympic-sports-youre-not-too-old-for-4075439
source.cec2b8ee:
#The gymnast Simone Biles and Self-confidence.

Simone Biles explained that what she is supposed to do in competition and what she actually accomplished in training Thursday morning do not match up.

"I don't think you realize how dangerous this is on hard/competition surface," Simone wrote about the twist. "Nor do I have to explain why I put my health first. Physical health is mental health."

"She explained that in competition, she is supposed to do one-and-a-half more twists than what she was able to do in training. "Almost there but not quite," 

"Sometimes I can't even fathom twisting. I seriously cannot comprehend how to twist. Strangest & weirdest thing as well as feeling."

If she is not able to comprehend, imagine the others that are just average. As in others professions we're NOT able to understand how things work. It's helpful to other persons see that even those that are on Top have that kind of feeling. All my solidarity to Simone's decision.

https://abcnews.go.com/Sports/simone-biles-explains-withdrawal-olympics-mind-body-simply/story?id=79157744
